repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

userestrict.head: Ownership Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford Museum Collection (SC0148). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

Wine bottle: Stanford Alumni Association. 1992 Pedroncelli Dry Creek Sauvignon Raymond Burr Vineyards. Label includes the LSJU monogram from the Founding Grant.
Wine Bottle. 29x27 cm diam. Pure California Port, product of Vina Winnery, Vina, Calif.
Wine glass "50 Humanities Sciences 1948-1998" with paper souvenirs rolled and tied to stem of glass
Wine glass class of '62, 25th reunion in red letters. 82 x 6cm.
Women's "S" society pin 1920
Women's athletic trophies, 36 trophies, various shapes and sizes
Women's bathing suits

scopecontent.p: 1. Bathing Suit: Blue and red, c. 1920 2. Bathing Suit: Gray, c. 1920, 2 pieces 3. Bathing Suit: Black and red, c. 1920.

scopecontent.p: 1. Gym suit: green dress and shorts, c. 1950; 2. Gym suit: green dress and shorts, c. 1950.

did.unittitle: Wood carving of Stanford Roughs, c. 1915; 47x33cm
Wood splinter from goal post of Stanford v. USC football game, Nov. 11, 1933
Wood tie from Roble bridge
wooden abacus
Wooden Axe: painted red with "Stanford" in white letters on blade
Wooden bench kept outside a frat house with names carved on it, mostly from the 1940s-50s. Bench has plate: "Presented by James Choate '06"
Wooden box for lantern slides from Fur Seal investigation with leather straps (PC 14)
Wooden box with glass top that once held spike (the gold one?) from joining of railroads at Promontory Point. Detailed note on bottom of box.
Wooden Pestle, 23cm high
Wooden plaque with image of basketball players, the year 1925, "Japanese Club," and garlands in 3d metal
Wooden rectangle possibly used as base for wall-hung phone
Wooden relay stick from 1917 UC-Stanford track meet (inscribed)
Wooden sign "Keep off the cinders" (16 x 18 in.)
wooden sign (in 3 parts): GAY PEOPLES UNION. Red letters on black boards.
wooden sign: GLAS [Gays and Lesbians at Stanford] - 4 letters unpainted on white painted board
wooden sign: GPU [Gay People's Union] in brown letters on red board, with an arrow pointing up at an angle [presumably once directed visitors up the stairs at the Old Firehouse]
Wooden tray (13 in. long) carved in shape of a fish, with eye, tail, and markings for scales and one fin.
Woodworking tools made by Prof. Stanley. 7 rosewood planes and 2 rosewood scribes.
Yell megaphone - "Stanford Indians", ca. 1950, 7 in.

Yellow gold Patek Phillipe pocket watch given to Jane Stanford by Leland Stanford Jan. 1, 1868. Also includes spiral bound information packet on the watch (prepared in conjunction with its auction on ebay, 2005) with photos and copy of the authentication certificate from Patek Phillipe.
